meanings.definition: A person who unlawfully occupies an uninhabited building or unused land.
meanings.sent1: The squatters were removed from the abandoned house.
meanings.sent2: The squatters set up camp in the old factory.
meanings.sent3: The squatters accidentally scared away the birds nesting there.
meanings.sent4: The squatters' presence in the empty warehouse was like a shadow lingering.
meanings.sent5: The image of the squatters sneaking into the deserted mansion stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A group of people who settle on land without legal claim or title.
meanings.sent1: The squatters formed a community in the forest clearing.
meanings.sent2: The authorities evicted the squatters from the public park.
meanings.sent3: The squatters' picnic on the private property was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The squatters' settlement resembled a bustling village in the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The squatters' laughter echoed through the valley as they made themselves at home.

meanings.definition: The act of settling on land without permission or legal right.
meanings.sent1: The squatters' presence on the farm raised concerns among the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The government took action to prevent further squatters from occupying the land.
meanings.sent3: The squatters' dance party on the forbidden property was a bold move.
meanings.sent4: The idea of nature reclaiming the land from the squatters seemed poetic.
meanings.sent5: The squatters' footprints marked their unauthorized entry into the restricted area.
